page.title: 07DYFFRYN GARDENS (1)
page.content: {Horticulture The largest and most visited botanic garden in Wales, Dyffryn, comprises 30 hectares of landscaped gardens, containing 6000 different kinds of plants. It has much to offer members of the general public and is easily reached from the M4 motorway. Horticulturally, it is favoured by soil conditions and its proximity to the sea. There are 8 large glasshouses with orchids, gesneriads and succulent plants. Two contain impressive displays of pot-plants. The Tropical Palm House exhibits include tropical,sub-tropical,exotic and economic plants. Dyffryn Gardens are of exceptional interest to the horticulturist, with many Far Eastern botanical treasures. The collection of rare trees includes specimens, the finest of their kind in Britain.
